name: places/ChIJ8U3LjXJZwokRsVu7IwHtkWc
formattedAddress: Union Square W, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: Union Square W, New York, NY 10003, USA

originalText.text:
4/15/2023, Sat: Shushan Valley Tomatoes grows local, fresh, no-spray tomatoes in a greenhouse  hydroponically in NY State a few hours north of NYC in Washington County, NY, and sells in person at the Union Square Greenmarket most Wednesdays and Saturdays in the off-season October through May and later, when very few if any other vendors have any local, fresh tomatoes.  You can buy their local tomatoes from a heated tent when it is well below freezing.  The owners are often present, and sell heirloom varieties such as an Italian heirloom red tomato and Purple Cherokee and yellow and orange varieties, as well as regular red beefsteak and vine tomatoes and cherry tomatoes, and herb plants and fresh basil.  The tomatoes are much better than what you typically find in retail stores, and last longer.  There is a reduced price for the saucers that have minor blemishes, that can beat the deals you can find in most stores.
- 4/19/23, Wed, pictures from today after 3:30pm after the owner Phyllis from Shushan Valley Tomatoes, and the staff were packing up, but still selling to customers and very friendly even at the end of the market day.  I purchased a selection of beefsteak and Italian heirloom red tomatoes in great condition.
